message_1: A population of rabbits and foxes are living on an island. The population of rabbits reproduce at a rate of 0.6 per day and the population of foxes hunt and eat rabbits reducing their population at a rate of 0.3 per day. The initial population of rabbits on the island is 20 and the initial population of foxes is 10. Write a differential equation for the population of rabbits and foxes and use it to determine the number of rabbits and foxes after 30 days.
